item.title: Litter from College Students, 1st December
item.description:
Email received by CSC inbox 30/11/25 • Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: As you walk from London South East college on the pavement (left hand side towards bus stop BU), the amount of rubbish discarded by student next the pavement is digusting. By no means I am expecting the council to use our council tax to clean up after the uneducated pupils but I am certainly expecting the council to this back to the college director and get the college to clean this area regularly and also to educate their students that we don't live on an animal farm! There is all sort of litter in the grass next to this pavement keading from the college all the well the bus stop BU. We don't live in this lovely area of London to see this every day. Please can this be dealt with. We need the college to clean this up and to monitor it daily. • What action (if any) would you like us to take? As described above. Photos are available on request but the council is welcome to visit the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A21, Bromley Common, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple cars parked illegally in communal garden, 1st December
item.description:
Several cars regularly park on the grass in the communal garden. This is a RISK TO LIFE as children play there. The offenders open the gate between the garden and the garages. You can see the gate open in the photo. Simply changing the lock would fix it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Johns Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No Street Cleaning for 2 Months, 1st December
item.description:
Haringey-Veolia claims to provide a weekly street cleaning service here every Thursday. There has been no regular street cleaning of Beatrice Road N4 for over 2 months. Clusters of litter are neglected for weeks on end. They include hazards such as glass fragments across footways following car break-in; bottles, broken glass and drug paraphernalia dumped on footways and in gutters, flattened tin cans, rotting food waste. Please can the regular street cleaning service be implemented as advertised so that Beatrice Road receives a thorough and regular clean-up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Beatrice Road, Stroud Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown with weeds and litter, 1st December
item.description:
St Michaels Road hasnt been weeded or cleaned in weeks. The leaves are clogging up the drains and the weeds are pushing up the paving slabs. The piles of litter are attracting even more rats and foxes. Can something be done?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Michael's Road, Stockwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: As last year all the Christmas lights works apart fro the one opposite my flat (outside Zizzis 157 High St Beckenham, 1st December
item.description:
The Christmas lights don’t come on … It’s such a short time that the lights are up so please can it be sorted asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 212-214, High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bins overflowing for months, 1st December
item.description:
I live on this street and this particular property/properties bins are attracting vermin, foxes and they smell bad, not to mention looking horrific. There are often used condoms, disgusting items left on the pavement. The bins are never emptied because they are used incorrectly but it is getting to the point where sometimes people can’t walk past it. Lease found they be emptied? Or even removed? The whole end of the road suffers because of these properties and bins. These pictures don’t fully show the disgusting mess.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Combedale Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
